expected_output.description: SQL injection vulnerability. User input is directly interpolated into SQL query using f-string.
expected_output.fix_suggestion: Use parameterized queries: db.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?', (user_id,))

expected_output.description: Mutable default argument. The list will persist and be shared across all function calls without arguments.
expected_output.fix_suggestion:
Use None as default: def process_items(items=None):
    items = items if items is not None else []
    items.append('processed')
    return items

expected_output.description: Bare except clause catches all exceptions including KeyboardInterrupt and SystemExit. Silently passing hides errors.
expected_output.fix_suggestion:
Catch specific exceptions and handle them: except SpecificException as e:
    logger.error(f'Operation failed: {e}')
